configuration.name: mc-item-022398373670876026
configuration.title: Animal Responses to Environmental Stimuli
configuration.stem: The turkey vulture, spider, and bat use different types of stimuli to find food. Match each animal with the type of stimulus the animal is responding to.

feedBack.firstWrongHint: Review the text that describes the ways these animals get their food.
feedBack.finalWrongHint: Turkey vultures use odor to find their food, spiders rely on motion in their webs to catch their prey, and bats use echolocation to hear and locate objects.

cells.label: Turkey vultures are scavengers.
